What I’m learning is there are 2 questions - insuring if they get stolen or damaged (the bike), and liability if you get in a crash and get sued or something. My insurer is saying if you have a non-e-bike you don’t need extra liability (and homeowners maybe covers the bike),

But for an e-bike they say it’s a “motorized vehicle” and thus want the auto policy to cover it as a vehicle with significant added cost “because it goes faster” (as the agent relayed it, which isn’t really true).

Road safety. For every road, there are only five options:

1. Remove motor vehicles

2. Remove cyclists & pedestrians

3. Physically segregate them

4. Reduce speeds and traffic volumes enough to make mixing safe

5. Admit you’d rather people die than accept any of options 1-4

This was the map around when I moved to NYC in 2002. B, D end at 34th because the north side of the Manhattan Bridge was under repair. There’s a separate orange V and brown M which were more recently combined. No 7 extension; no SAS so Q ends at 57/7. G continues to Forest Hills.
